abstract: Petrobras is paying just 0.21 percent of the total size of the offering, but that’s still a lot for bankers to share.
snippet: Petrobras is paying just 0.21 percent of the total size of the offering, but that’s still a lot for bankers to share.
lead_paragraph: Brazil’s sale of about $79 billion of stock in Petróleo Brasileiro looks set for a string of financial superlatives. One of them, however, won’t be loudly crowed about by investment bankers. The underwriting fee on the deal, which is expected to close this week, appears to be among the lowest in a global stock offering of this kind.

headline.main: A Good Payday for Banks in Petrobras Sale
headline.print_headline: A Good Payday In Petrobras Sale

byline.original: By Rob Cox and Una Galani

abstract: Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan on Wednesday asked a federal court in Chicago to halt BHP Billiton’s $39 billion hostile offer.
snippet: Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan on Wednesday asked a federal court in Chicago to halt BHP Billiton’s $39 billion hostile offer.
lead_paragraph: 12:36 p.m. | Updated Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan on Wednesday asked a federal court in Chicago to halt BHP Billiton‘s $39 billion hostile offer.

abstract: Potash asserted the mining company made “false and misleading statements and omissions” in its $38.6 billion offer.
snippet: Potash asserted the mining company made “false and misleading statements and omissions” in its $38.6 billion offer.
lead_paragraph: OTTAWA  The Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan, the world’s largest fertilizer maker, filed a lawsuit on Wednesday in an effort to block a hostile $38.6 billion takeover offer from the mining company, BHP Billiton.

headline.main: Potash Corp. Files a Suit to Stop Takeover by BHP
headline.print_headline: Potash Corp. Files a Suit To Stop Takeover by BHP

abstract: The latest attempt by the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan to derail BHP Billiton’s $39 billion hostile bid could be somewhat of a Hail Mary pass, possibly pointing to the beginning of the end of this takeover battle.
snippet: The latest attempt by the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan to derail BHP Billiton’s $39 billion hostile bid could be somewhat of a Hail Mary pass, possibly pointing to the beginning of the end of this takeover battle.
lead_paragraph: The latest attempt by the Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan to derail BHP Billiton’s $39 billion hostile bid could be somewhat of a Hail Mary pass, possibly pointing to the beginning of the end of this takeover battle.

headline.main: Behind Potash’s Legal Move to Stop BHP
